intro: Artemisia baldshuanica, commonly known as the Tibetan wormwood, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of Tibet and adjacent regions. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, often found in alpine meadows and mountainous areas. Its leaves contain essential oils and have been used traditionally in herbal medicine. Artemisia baldshuanica is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in harsh climates.
